channel.title: [NEED HELP] Can't connect to my server
channel.description:
So i have portforwarded [IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/1kml5.png[/img]
My server is running on my ip.
my client is changed to my ip.
and i still get error connecting to server.
i have never been able to solve this problem.

item.title: [NEED HELP] Can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @i_pk_mods_ftw i pk mods ftw
item.description:
@i_pk_mods_ftw wrote:

how do i get to making an exception on firewall?

Ok so its a PI my client is changed to my ip and the server has an ip to? so what should i change the servers ip to??

Read full topic
item.source: [NEED HELP] Can't connect to my server

item.title: [NEED HELP] Can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

2 things that all these noobs forgot to mention.

check your GUI.java and EGUI.java for an IP.

Next, go to your firewall, make an exception for RSPS 43594 TCP
then make another for RSPS 43594 UDP

because you can’t do both when it comes to fire walls :#

Read full topic

item.title: [NEED HELP] Can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @MR_Terror MR Terror
item.description:
@MR_Terror wrote:

[quote=“I am Nick, post:3, topic:427878”][quote author=jwags link=topic=530569.msg3874597#msg3874597 date=1325567483]
3 things
one - what the hell kinda pic is this
two - is ur source running?
three - log in ur client using “192.168.1.1” as the ip. if that dont work then ur client is bad and get a new one. if it does tell me and ill try to think of another potential prob.
folder files then client.java and search for the old ip
such as 192.168.1.1 or what ever his old ip was.
[/quote]
192.168.1.1 is ipconfig it is not localhost localhost is 127.0.0.1[/quote] TROLLED

Read full topic
